com.googlecode.streamflyer.regex
Interface OnStreamMatcher

All Superinterfaces:
MatchResult
All Known Implementing Classes:
OnStreamStandardMatcher
public interface OnStreamMatcher
extends MatchResult

Similar to Matcher, implementations of this interface allow to match regular expressions on a CharSequence.

In comparison to Matcher, this type provides the method findUnlessHitEnd(int, int) that is particularly useful when you want to match a regular expression on character streams.

What is the technical idea behind this matcher? The purpose of this matcher is too extend the class Matcher with the following code. 

    private int lastFrom;

    public boolean findUntilMatchOrHitEnd(int from, int to) {
        this.hitEnd = false;
        this.requireEnd = false;
        from        = from < 0 ? 0 : from;
        this.first  = from;
        this.oldLast = oldLast < 0 ? from : oldLast;
        for (int i = 0; i < groups.length; i++)
            groups[i] = -1;
        acceptMode = NOANCHOR;
        boolean result = false;
        for (this.lastFrom = from; lastFrom <= to; lastFrom++) {
            result = parentPattern.matchRoot.match(this, lastFrom, text);
            if (result || hitEnd()) {
                break;
            }
        }
        if (!result)
            this.first = -1;
        this.oldLast = this.last;
        return result;
    }

     public int lastFrom() {
        return lastFrom;
    }

Unfortunately, Matcher cannot by extended via subclassing because Matcher is a final type. The new interface OnStreamMatcher provides all methods necessary to do match regular expresions on character stream including the method findUnlessHitEnd(int, int).

Since:
20.06.2011
Author:
rwoo

Method Detail

reset

See Also:
Matcher.reset(CharSequence)

findUnlessHitEnd

boolean findUnlessHitEnd(int minFrom,
                         int maxFrom)
Looks for the first position that could be the start of a match that starts in the range [ from (including), maxFrom (including)]. If such a position is found, then the method stops and returns true if the input provides enough characters to make a match.

ATTENTION! maxFrom can be the position behind(!) the last character of the input.

This first position can retrieved via lastFrom().

Parameters:
minFrom -
maxFrom -
Returns:
Returns true if the method found a match at the position lastFrom().

hitEnd

boolean hitEnd()
See Also:
Matcher.hitEnd()

requireEnd

boolean requireEnd()
See Also:
Matcher.requireEnd()

lastFrom

int lastFrom()
This property is set by calling findUnlessHitEnd(int, int) .

ATTENTION! This property returns maxFrom + 1, if findUnlessHitEnd(int, int) neither has found a match nor has hit the end of input as long it looked for matches that started somewhere in the interval [minFrom, maxFrom].

ATTENTION! This information is not really helpful when the buffer size is equal to maxFrom. In this case you cannot say whether the position of lastFrom is the start of a potential match or not.

Returns:
Returns the last position findUnlessHitEnd(int, int) has investigated before it returned.
